Posts.Content: Hi. The first mammogram I had after my radiation treatments ended showed some calcification. The research I did at that time (11 years ago) indicated that it wasn't too much of a risk as long as there were no large, definited clusters of the calcification - and there weren't. There were just some scattered points. The next mammogram after that - about 4 months later - was totally clear. Meredith
Posts.Title: Breast Calcification

Posts.Content: I, too, would appreciate knowing how your friend found out her cancer had come back. I'm a 11 1/2 year survivor and have had pains in the area of my surgery for several months now. They come and go and my doctor thinks it's some type of nerve inflammation. I did have a mammogram and it was negative. You can use my email, if you like. It's --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ----. Thank you. Meredith
Posts.Title: Return Cancer
